title: Pattachitra
hero_image_alt: Intricate Pattachitra painting of Lord Jagannath
short_description: Traditional scroll painting from Odisha known for its intricate details and mythological narratives of Lord Jagannath.
long_description:
Pattachitra is a traditional cloth-based scroll painting from Odisha. The name comes from 'Patta' (cloth) and 'Chitra' (picture). This art form is closely related to the cult of Shri Jagannath and the temple traditions in Puri. 

The canvas is prepared by coating cotton cloth with a mixture of chalk and gum made from tamarind seeds. It is then rubbed with two different stones to make it smooth and shiny. The paintings are known for their intricate details, bold lines, and lack of landscapes or perspective. The themes are chiefly mythological, revolving around Lord Jagannath and the Vaishnava sect.

major_centres.title: Raghurajpur
major_centres.summary: Heritage craft village where Pattachitra flourishes.

authenticity_tips: Traditional Pattachitra has a leathery finish due to the lacquer coating.
